title: Paper Talks
description: A platform for researchers and students to present innovative technical papers. Gain feedback, enhance presentation skills, and engage in insightful discussions. Top presentations will be recognized and awarded.

guidelines.1: Presentations should be in PPT format.
guidelines.2: Your presentation slides should not exceed 20 slides.
guidelines.3: You should be prepared to complete your presentation within 5-6 minutes to ensure smooth flow and fairness to all participants.
guidelines.4: Avoid text-heavy slides. Instead, incorporate images, graphs, charts, and videos to make your presentation visually appealing and engaging.
guidelines.5: You can participate alone or as a team of maximum 2 members (not more than that).

title: Protovision
description: Showcase your prototypes and bring ideas to life with working models. Demonstrate creativity, solve real-world problems, and collaborate with fellow innovators. The best prototypes will be rewarded.

guidelines.1: Your project must be presented using PPT format, with an optional live demonstration or prototype.
guidelines.2: Each team will have 6-8 minutes to present their project, followed by a Q&A session.
guidelines.3: You can participate alone or in a team of up to 3 members (max limit: 3 members per team).
guidelines.4: The project must be your original work and not copied from existing solutions.

title: Bug Bash
description: Participants will be provided with faulty code snippets written in programming languages like C, C++, Java, or Python. Your task is to identify the errors, correct them, and ensure the program runs successfully.

guidelines.1: The competition will be conducted in two rounds.
guidelines.2: Participants will be judged based on accuracy, efficiency, and speed of debugging.
guidelines.3: Use of any external resources, mobile phones, or internet is strictly prohibited.
guidelines.4: Please make sure to bring you own laptops.

title: Code Blitz
description: A fast-paced coding competition testing algorithmic and problem-solving skills. Think critically, optimize your code, and compete for the top spot. The best coders will be rewarded

guidelines.1: The contest will have two rounds
guidelines.2: Solutions will be judged based on accuracy, efficiency, and execution time.
guidelines.3: Use of pre-written templates or AI tools is strictly prohibited.
guidelines.4: Participants must write clean, readable, and well-structured code.
guidelines.5: Please make sure to bring you own laptops.

title: Web Wizard
description: Design and develop functional, responsive websites based on given themes. Showcase your front-end and back-end expertise, unleash creativity, and compete for top honors!

guidelines.1: Themes will be provided on the spot.
guidelines.2: Use HTML, CSS, and JavaScript (Frameworks like Bootstrap or Tailwind are allowed for faster development).
guidelines.3: Only 1 hour will be given for designing and development.
guidelines.4: Participants must submit their project as a zipped folder containing the source files or a GitHub repository link.
guidelines.5: The website must be built from scratch (No pre-built templates or AI-generated designs).
guidelines.6: The website should have a working navigation and basic interactivity.
guidelines.7: Please make sure to bring you own laptops.

title: Puzzle Quest
description: A thrilling challenge that puts your logic and problem-solving skills to the test. Crack puzzles, decode riddles, and outsmart the competition. Only the sharpest minds will emerge victorious!

guidelines.1: The quiz will be conducted in two rounds.
guidelines.2: Each question will have a time limit to answer.
guidelines.3: No external help or internet searches are allowed.
guidelines.4: Participants must follow fair play rules.
